name: Alfalfa
description: an herbal infusion made from the leaves and flowers of the alfalfa plant, known for its rich nutrient profile. This tea is often appreciated for its mild, earthy flavor and is typically brewed from fresh or dried alfalfa leaves
Health Benefits: rich in nutrients, supports digestive health, weight loss, antioxidant properties, lower cholesterol, boost immune system, anti-inflammatory

name: Anji Bai Cha
description: a rare and prized green tea known for its delicate flavor, light color, and high-quality leaves. It is made from the young leaves of the tea plant, which are hand-picked and processed with care to preserve their freshness and unique characteristics
Health Benefits: rich in antioxidants, boosts metabolism, reduce risk of cardiovascular disease, support digestive function, calming function
Flavor Profile: light, sweet, and refreshing with a subtle grassy note

name: Ashwagandha
Alternative Name: Indian ginseng, Winter cherry, Withania somnifera, Ayurvedic ginseng, Ashwagandhadi churna
description: a herbal tea made from the leaves and roots of the Ashwagandha plant, a perennial shrub native to India and other parts of Asia.
origin: India, China, Africa, and the Middle East
region: Tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa
Health Benefits: Reduces stress and anxiety, improves sleep quality, enhances cognitive function, boosts energy, antioxidant properties, anti-inflammatory, lowers blood pressure
Flavor Profile: Earthy, slightly bitter, and nutty flavor

name: Assamica
Alternative Name: Assam, Camellia sinensis assamica, Indian black tea
description: a type of black tea derived from the Camellia sinensis assamica plant. It is known for its robust flavor and amber color, often enjoyed both plain and with milk.
Health Benefits: rick in antioxidants, reduce risk of cardiovascular disease, improve mental alertness, supports digestive health, weight loss, lower blood sugar
Flavor Profile: Bold, malty, and brisk with a slightly astringent finish, sometimes with hints of chocolate or caramel.

name: Avocado Leaf
Alternative Name: Tejocote leaves, Avocado leaf infusion, Persea americana leaves
description: a herbal tea made from the leaves of the avocado tree (Persea americana). The leaves are often used in culinary applications in various cultures, particularly in Central America, and can be brewed into a soothing herbal infusion.
Health Benefits: regulate blood sugar, antioxidant properties, aid in deigestion, anti-inflammatory, relieve respiratory issues, antimicrobial benefits
Flavor Profile: Mildly herbal and slightly nutty, with a hint of bitterness

name: Bai Hao Oolong
Alternative Name: Oriental Beauty, White Tip Oolong, Dongfang Meiren
description: a highly regarded variety of oolong tea known for its distinctive flavor profile and aroma. It is produced from fully oxidized leaves and boasts a unique fruity and floral taste, often compared to that of black tea, yet retaining some characteristics of oolong.
Health Benefits: rich in antioxidants, aid in weight management, boosts metabolism, lower cholesterol, supports digesttive health, enhance mental alertness, anti-inflammatory
Flavor Profile: A well-balanced blend of sweet, fruity, and floral notes, often accompanied by a honey-like quality

name: Bai Mu Dan
description: a type of white tea made from young tea leaves and buds. It is known for its delicate, floral notes and a slightly grassy flavor. The name "Bai Mudan" translates to "white peony," reflecting the beautiful, silvery-green leaves and buds that resemble peony petals.
Health Benefits: rich in antioxidants, aid in weight management, boosts immune system, supports cardiovascular health, anti-inflammatory, slows aging
Flavor Profile: a light, delicate flavor with floral and fruity notes, along with a subtle sweetness

name: Tieguanyin
Alternative Name: Iron Goddess, Iron Goddess of Mercy
